geeklist.title: Aussie Mid Year Maths Trade 2014
geeklist.description:
Welcome to the Aussie Mid Year Maths Trade 2014.
This is proudly brought you by the same old team. Participants please read and adhere to the rules.
[b][size=14]Rules:[/size][/b]
:d10-1: This trade is open to Australian BGGers only.
:d10-2: This trade is open to board games, expansions, card games, game accessories, RPG, video games and the like. Please don't add anything else. If you intend to allow a game to be exchanged for cash (i.e. you're selling), include the amount you will accept for it in the price. You may consider compare current market prices (ebay, BGG market, local shop). The cash value is for the MT purpose only, so any off MT dealings are person to person.
:d10-3: Golden rule: [b][size=11]SENDER PAYS SHIPPING[/size][/b]. Even if you're selling a game for cash, or you post from Perth to Townsville or Hobart. So, make sure you set your price high enough that you would be happy to pay shipping to anywhere else in Australia out of that money. By posting an item to this list you are agreeing that you can and will mail it anywhere in Australia at your expense. Avoid any conditional trades (such as pick up only at BorderCon, etc).
:d10-4: Items included in the maths trade are expected to remain as part of the maths trade until the closing date. [b][COLOR=#FF0033]If your intention is to sell an item there are other alternatives in BGG to do so[/COLOR][/b]. If an item is not longer available for whatever reason, please [b]DELETE[/b] it. [size=10]If you decide to drop an item from the list, please do so [u]before the due date of the game submission deadline[/u].[/size] List order will be as per submissions. Note: your items could end up with a different item number due to deletions, so please check the official after the geeklist has been closed. Refer to the deadlines below.
[COLOR=#FF0033][size=10]After closure of item submissions, don't delete your items. If you don't want to trade them anymore, simple submit an empty want list.[/size][/COLOR]
:d10-5: Provide as much details as possible (edition, language, sleeved cards, game condition, etc). Pick a picture that represents the game you're offering if there are multiple versions or publishers. If necessary, take a picture of the game, upload it to your gallery, and use that image. Feel free to use the game condition rating previously suggested by petegs to describe your items:
[b]New in shrink[/b] - which means never opened. [b]Opened but unpunched[/b] - I've looked at the game but not punched counters yet or stickered blocks etc. [b]Opened and punched[/b] - Looked at, even punched counters etc but haven't played. [b]Opened and played[/b].
Count pieces to make sure the games are complete, and accurately list any components that are missing or damaged. Please look at your trade pile to make sure the game is really there. In order to make your items more (or less) appealing, you may want to add one or more "sweeteners" to the item listing -- an expansion, a related game, or a completely unrelated item that you think will make it a more desirable package. Items for which there is no BGG listing can be listed as Miscellaneous Game Accessory.
:d10-6: Cash option is available. Australian BGG registered users can participate even without submitting an item to the trade with the cash option by submitting want list before the due date.
:d10-7: Maths Traders will not be required to add cash value to the geeklist - that will be handled in the want lists. In the case that a buyer offers more than a seller is asking, the buyer will pay the seller's price.
:d10-8: There is no limit of items to be submitted in this trade. Duplicates of items already on the list are fine. Traders can combine multiple games into one item (e.g. 7 Wonders plus expansions).
:d10-9: Keep comments for listed items to a minimum. There is a separate thread for any ad hoc messages. Also, refer to the BGG forum conditions and adhere your responses to them.
:d10-1::d10-0: [b][size=12]Deadlines:[/size][/b]
Add items to the list by: [size=10][b]10pm Saturday 10 May 2014[/b][/size]. EST (SYD/CBR) Australian Time.
Official item list posted by: [b]10pm Tuesday 13 May 2014[/b]. EST (SYD/CBR) Australian Time.
Want Lists due by: [b]10pm Friday 16 May 2014[/b]. EST (SYD/CBR) Australian Time.
[COLOR=#000099][b]Want list submission via GeekMail to[/b] [/COLOR]
[user=Friendless][/user]
Official Results posted at Friendless discretion from during weekend 17-18 May 2014.
No extensions for deadlines above will be granted. For respect to your fellow Maths Traders and to have enough time as people may need to get their games to a willing 'games mule' attending BorderCon 2014.
[b]Wiki:[/b]
If you require further details about Maths Trade information and how to prepare your want list, please refer to the [geekurl=/wiki/page/Aussie_Maths_Trade#]Assie Math Trade wiki[/geekurl].
If you would like to post comments about the MT the thread is below:
[geekurl=/thread/1162755/aussie-mid-year-maths-trade-2014]Aussie Mid Year MT Thread[/geekurl]
Thank you all for your participation.

Original boxed copy. The game is complete, with rulebooks and all the tokens, terrain pieces, and even the extra arms/weapons for all the miniatures. All the contents are in very good condition, with the following exceptions:
-Most of the cardboard terrain pieces have a stripe of tape along the edges where they attach to the plastic bulkheads - this was done to prevent fraying, and the tape is mostly concealed when the terrain is assembled, but it's probably a downer for collectors nonetheless.
-There is 15cm tear in the front face of the box cover. This was present when I bought the last copy from a GW store all those many years ago, and is not an indication of mistreatment. The box has never been crushed.
-The models, though unpainted, do each have a number painted on the edge of the base in primer. I doubt this will be a problem for anyone.
I would also include one leader and one heavy (white metal) for each of the two factions included in the box (Orlock and Goliath) bringing the total number of minis up to 28. There is also an "Imperial Bastion" that is assembled from the same plastic bulkheads and cardboard as the other terrain, and makes a good extra terrain piece.
[b]Will accept cash:[/b] $185

[thing=472][/thing] [b]plus[/b] [thing=1143][/thing] [ImageID=184398inline] [ImageID=115311inline] These are the 1980s Games Workshop releases, not the more recent FFG releases. DungeonQuest is in excellent condition for its age. All miniatures are unbroken and unpainted, and the game is complete bar some plastic counters that are easily substituted, and one non-essential card (of which there are duplicates anyway). Warrior Knights is missing a couple of non-essential paper counters (there are multiples of these, and it's unlikely you'll need all of them unless you're totally dominating the map, in which case you can probably substitute).
[b]Will accept cash:[/b] $35

In need of some TLC but hey its 30+ years old.
The box is very shelf worn, no splits so still solid, but definately shows its age.
There is no copy of the rules, nor is there an AST sheet, however both are easily printable from BGG. http://boardgamegeek.com/filepage/91498/civilization-rules http://boardgamegeek.com/filepage/58743/redesigned-ast
Egypt is missing 1 unit token. Illyria is missing 1 unit token. Thace is missing 1 unit token and 1 city. Should be easy enough to print decent replacement pieces. Even without its fully playable up to 6 players as is.
Board has some very slight warping but a flat surface and some heavy books should sort that.
OK thats full disclosure done.
Despite all of the above i wont be trading this lightly. This game is an absolute beast of epic proportions. Its no ameritrash or 60 min engine thash, its one of the best designed stratergy games ever IMO. However it is very long, too long for me to get a game in anymore :( a full game is 5 to 12 hours my longest being run over 2 days, worth every second. Hopefully someone else can give it the love it desirves.

In pretty good condition for a game published in 1995. Box is showing normal signs of age. The rulebook, sourcebook, terrain pieces, minis and tokens are all in great condition. The game is almost complete, except for the following missing bits:
[b]Plastic minis[/b] - 2 of the 12 plastic Orlock Fighters are missing. One I replaced with an [geekurl=/image/322632/necromunda][u]unpainted Orlock Heavy[/u][/geekurl]. I have searched around, there are plenty of the original plastic (and metal) minis for sale on ebay. The Goliath Fighters are complete (12) and I have included an extra unpainted Goliath Heavy.
[b]Plastic Bulkhead[/b] - 1 of the 30 [geekurl=/image/1415782/necromunda][u]grey plastic bulkeads[/u][/geekurl] is missing. Once again there are plenty of spares available online.
[b]Red plastic range ruler[/b] - 1 of the 2 [geekurl=/image/214722/necromunda][u]red plastic range rulers[/u][/geekurl] is missing.
[b]Cardboard L-shaped walk-way[/b] - Can not find the L-shaped cardboard walk-way piece.
Today I have successfully stripped my terrible teenage paint job from the plastic minis using [geekurl=/blogpost/17505/how-to-strip-paint-with-dettol][u]this guide on the geek[/u][/geekurl]. They came up really well :). I also have lots of extra arms and weapons still unpunched for customising your gang.
I have asked my poor mother to look through some of my stuff at her place to try and find the missing pieces. If they turn up I will certainly ship them.
[b]Trade or cash offers accepted[/b]
